snippet: Jayson Nix, who hit the batting-practice fly that Mariano Rivera was hurt chasing, was himself the victim of a freak injury while bunting at the Beijing Olympics.
abstract: New York Yankees utility player Jayson Nix, who hit the batting-practice fly ball that closer Mariano Rivera was hurt chasing, was himself the victim of a freak injury while bunting at the 2008 Olympics. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: KANSAS CITY, Mo. -- Jayson Nix lowered his head and didn't realize what had happened until Alex Rodriguez said, ''Oh, my God; oh, my God,'' and told Joe Girardi to get out to center field, where Mariano Rivera had just sustained a season-ending knee injury. It was a cruel bit of fate that Nix was the one who hit the ball to the outfield in his first round of batting practice before his first Yankee game.
